ColumnB: A patient whose treatment regimen needed to be terminated or permanently changed a to a new regimen or treatment strategy.

A patient with pulmonary TB with bacteriologically confirmed TB at the beginning of treatment who completed treatment as recommended by the national policy, with evidence of bacteriological response b and no evidence of failure.
A patient who completed treatment as recommended by the national policy but whose outcome does not meet the definition for cure or treatment failure.
A patient who died c before starting treatment or during the course of treatment.
A patient who did not start treatment or whose treatment was interrupted for 2 consecutive months or more.
A patient for whom no treatment outcome was assigned. d
The sum of all patients cured and treatment completed.

ColumnA: An optional definition was also proposed for use in operational research only

ColumnB: An individual assessed at 6 months (for DS-TB and DR-TB) and at 12 months (for DR-TB only) after successful TB treatment, who is alive and free of TB
